title: Steven Mitchell
text: Welcome to my weird lil website! It’s currently in development. Have a look around and you might find wildlife photography, work samples, publications, or maybe even a resume, but no promises.

title: About ME
text: I spent 8 years working as a wildlife biologist. I worked for the Forest Service - Region 5, Olympic and Mount Rainier National Parks, and Turnstone Environmental Consultants. I worked to monitor carnivore populations in the Sierra Nevadas, consult on ESA section 7 surveys for threatened and endangered bird species, mitigate human-wildlife conflict, and research zoonotic diseases.

title: About ME
text: I spent 8 years working as a wildlife biologist. I worked for the Forest Service - Region 5, Olympic and Mount Rainier National Parks, and Turnstone Environmental Consultants. I worked to monitor carnivore populations in the Sierra Nevadas, consult on ESA section 7 surveys for threatened and endangered bird species, mitigate human-wildlife conflict, and research zoonotic diseases.

title: About ME
text:
Now

In June 2025, I’m wrapping up my Master’s of Environmental Science & Management at UCSB’s Bren School. I’ve focused on technical training in data science, statistics, conservation planning, and environmental policy.

title: About ME
text:
Soon

I aim to work in the non-profit or public sectors applying quantitative techniques to environmental problem solving.

title: About ME
text:
What I do for fun

I backcountry ski, mountaineer, backpack, bike-pack, white-water paddle board, and generally get into stupid situations.


FIGHT ME.


I thought you wouldn’t find this sneaky text. Dang, this is embarassing…
